posts.title: Select from world
posts.text: SELECT from World1.Read the notes about this table. Observe the result of running this SQL command to show the name, continent and population of all countries. <ë°ì´í„°ë¥¼ ê´€ì°°í•˜ë¼> 12select name,continent,populationfrom world 2. How to use WHERE to filter records. Show the name for the countries that have a population of at least 200 million. 200 million is 200000000, there are eight zerosrds ì¸êµ¬ê°€ ìµœì†Œ 200millon ì´ìƒì¸ ë‚˜ë¼ì´ë¦„ì„ ì¶œë ¥í•˜ë¼ 12SELECT name FROM worldWHERE population >= 200000000 3.Give the name and the per capita GDP for those countries with a population of at least 200 million. ì¸êµ¬ê°€ 200000000 ì´ìƒì¸ ë‚˜ë¼ ì¡°ê±´ì—ì„œ , ì¸êµ¬ë³„ 1ì¸ë‹¹ gdpë¥¼ êµ¬í•˜ì—¬ë¼ 123select name,GDP/populationfrom world where population>=200000000 4.Show the name and population in millions for the countries of the continent â€˜South Americaâ€™. Divide the population by 1000000 to get population in millions. â€˜South Americaâ€™ ëŒ€ë¥™ì˜ ì´ë¦„ê³¼ ì¸êµ¬ë¥¼ 100ë§Œìœ¼ë¡œ ë‚˜ëˆˆê²ƒì„ ì¶œë ¥í•˜ë¼ 123select name,population/1000000from world where continent='South America' 5.Show the name and population for France, Germany, Italy â€˜Franceâ€™,â€™Germanyâ€™,â€™Italyâ€™ ì´ë¦„ì„ ê°€ì§„ ë‚˜ë¼ë“¤ì˜ ì´ë¦„ê³¼ ì¸êµ¬ë¥¼ ì¶œë ¥í•˜ë¼. 123select name,population from worldwhere name IN('France','Germany','Italy') IN ì—°ì‚°ìëŠ” OR ì—­í• ì„ í•œë‹¤. NAME ì— ê´„í˜¸ ì•ˆì˜ ë¬¸ìì—´ì´ ë“¤ì–´ê°„ NAMEì„ ë½‘ì•„ë‚¸ë‹¤. 6.Show the countries which have a name that includes the word â€˜Unitedâ€™ â€˜Unitedâ€™ ë¬¸ìì—´ì„ í¬í•¨í•˜ëŠ” ë‚˜ë¼ì˜ ì´ë¦„ì„ ì¶œë ¥í•˜ë¼ 123select name from worldwhere name like('%United%') 7.Two ways to be big: A country is big if it has an area of more than 3 million sq km or it has a population of more than 250 million. Show the countries that are big by area or big by population. Show name, population and area. ìœ„ì—ì„œ ì–¸ê¸‰í•œ ëŒ€ë„ì‹œì˜ ì¡°ê±´ì— ë¶€í•©í•˜ëŠ” name,population,area ë¥¼ ì¶œë ¥í•˜ë¼ 123select name,population,areafrom world where area>3000000 or population>250000000 OR ì—°ì‚°ì ì‚¬ìš© !! 8.Exclusive OR (XOR). Show the countries that are big by area (more than 3 million) or big by population (more than 250 million) but not both. Show name, population and area. Australia has a big area but a small population, it should be included. Indonesia has a big population but a small area, it should be included. China has a big population and big area, it should be excluded. United Kingdom has a small population and a small area, it should be excluded XOR ë¬¸ì œ A ìƒí™© ê³¼ Bìƒí™©ì„ êµ¬í•˜ë˜ , A,B ë‘˜ë‹¤ ì¼ì–´ë‚˜ëŠ” ìƒí™©ì€ ì œì™¸í•˜ë¼ 123select name,population,areafrom world where (area>3000000 or population>250000000) and NOT (area>3000000 and population>250000000) ê´„í˜¸ë¥¼ ë¬¶ì–´ì„œ ì›ë˜ ëŒ€ë„ì‹œì˜ ì¡°ê±´ì„ ë„£ì–´ì¤€ë‹¤. ê·¸ë¦¬ê³  AND ì—°ì‚°ìë¡œ BOTH ì— ì†Œí•˜ëŠ” ê²ƒë“¤ì€ ì œì™¸í•´ì¤€ë‹¤. 9.Show the name and population in millions and the GDP in billions for the countries of the continent â€˜South Americaâ€™. Use the ROUND function to show the values to two decimal places. For South America show population in millions and GDP in billions both to 2 decimal places. South America ì˜ 100ë§Œëª…ë‹¹ ì¸êµ¬ë¥¼ ì¶œë ¥í•˜ë¼ ê·¸ë¦¬ê³  gdp ë¥¼ 2ì§¸ìë¦¬ ê¹Œì§€ ë°˜ì˜¬ë¦¼ í•˜ì—¬ë¼ . 123select name,round(population/1000000,2),round(gdp/1000000000,2)from world where continent='South America' 10.Show the name and per-capita GDP for those countries with a GDP of at least one trillion (1000000000000; that is 12 zeros). Round this value to the nearest 1000. Show per-capita GDP for the trillion dollar countries to the nearest $1000. gdpê°€ ìµœì†Œ 1000000000000 ì¸ ë‚˜ë¼ì˜ 1ì¸ë‹¹ gdpë¥¼ 3ìë¦¬ê¹Œì§€ ë°˜ì˜¬ë¦¼í•˜ì—¬ í‘œí˜„í•˜ë¦¬ 123select name,round(gdp/population,-3) from world where gdp>=1000000000000 11.Greece has capital Athens. Each of the strings â€˜Greeceâ€™, and â€˜Athensâ€™ has 6 characters. Show the name and capital where the name and the capital have the same number of characters. You can use the LENGTH function to find the number of characters in a string For Microsoft SQL Server the function LENGTH is LEN (NAME ê³¼ CAPITAL ì˜ ìˆ«ì ê¸¸ì´ê°€ ê°™ì€ NAME ê³¼ CAPITAL ì„ ì¶œë ¥í•˜ë¼) 123SELECT name,capitalfrom world where LEN(name)=LEN(capital) 12.The capital of Sweden is Stockholm. Both words start with the letter â€˜Sâ€™. Show the name and the capital where the first letters of each match. Donâ€™t include countries where the name and the capital are the same word. You can use the function LEFT to isolate the first character. You can use <> as the NOT EQUALS operator. (NAME ê³¼ CAPITAL ì˜ ì™¼ìª½ì—ì„œ ì²«ë²ˆì§¸ ê¸€ìê°€ ê°™ì€ê²ƒì„ ì¶œë ¥í•˜ë©°, ì´ë¦„ê³¼ ìˆ˜ë„ê°€ ê°™ì§€ ì•Šì€ ê²ƒë“¤ì„ ì¶œë ¥í•˜ë¼) 123SELECT NAME,CAPITAL FROM WORLD WHERE LEFT(NAME,1)=LEFT(CAPITAL,1) AND NOT(NAME=CAPITAL) 13.Equatorial Guinea and Dominican Republic have all of the vowels (a e i o u) in the name. They donâ€™t count because they have more than one word in the name. Find the country that has all the vowels and no spaces in its name. You can use the phrase name NOT LIKE '%a%' to exclude characters from your results. The query shown misses countries like Bahamas and Belarus because they contain at least one â€˜aâ€™ (a,e,i,o,u ë¥¼ ëª¨ë‘ í¬í•¨í•˜ë©°, ë„ì–´ì“°ê¸°ë¥¼ í¬í•¨í•˜ì§€ ì•ŠëŠ” ë‚˜ë¼ë¥¼ ì¶œë ¥í•˜ë¼.) 123456789SELECT NAME FROM WORLDWHERE NAME LIKE('%a%') andNAME LIKE('%i%') andNAME LIKE('%e%') andNAME LIKE('%o%') andNAME LIKE('%u%') andNAME NOT LIKE('% %')

posts.text: SELECT NAME1.You can use WHERE name LIKE 'B%' to find the countries that start with â€œBâ€.
